intro: Ranunculus divaricatus, commonly known as the variable buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features delicate, yellow flowers with five to nine petals, often adorned with a distinctive central blotch. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with trifoliate leaves that are palmately arranged. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a food source for various pollinators and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
